verses.verse: The plans <WH4633> of the heart <WH3820> belong to man, <WH120> But the answer <WH4617> of the tongue <WH3956> is from the Lord. <WH3068>
All <WH3605> the ways <WH1870> of a man <WH376> are clean <WH2134> in his own sight, <WH5869> But the Lord <WH3068> weighs <WH8505> the motives. <WH7307>
Commit <WH1556> your works <WH4639> to the Lord, <WH3068> And your plans <WH4284> will be established. <WH3559>
The Lord <WH3068> has made <WH6466> everything <WH3605> for its own purpose, <WH4617> Even <WH1571> the wicked <WH7563> for the day <WH3117> of evil. <WH9567>
Everyone <WH3605> who is proud <WH1364> in heart <WH3820> is an abomination <WH8441> to the Lord; <WH3068> Assuredly, <WH3027> he will not be unpunished. <WH5352>
By lovingkindness <WH2617> and truth <WH571> iniquity <WH5771> is atoned <WH3722> for, And by the fear <WH3374> of the Lord <WH3068> one keeps <WH5493> away <WH5493> from evil. <WH9563>
When a man's ways <WH1870> are pleasing <WH7521> to the Lord, <WH3068> He makes <WH7999> even <WH1571> his enemies <WH340> to be at peace <WH7999> with him.
Better <WH2896> is a little <WH4592> with righteousness <WH6666> Than <WH4480> great <WH7230> income <WH8393> with injustice. <WH3808> <WH4941>
The mind <WH3820> of man <WH120> plans <WH2803> his way, <WH1870> But the Lord <WH3068> directs <WH3559> his steps. <WH6806>
A divine <WH7081> decision <WH7081> is in the lips <WH8193> of the king; <WH4428> His mouth <WH6310> should not err <WH4603> in judgment. <WH4941>
A just <WH4941> balance <WH6425> and scales <WH3976> belong to the Lord; <WH3068> All <WH3605> the weights <WH68> of the bag <WH3599> are His concern. <WH4639>
It is an abomination <WH8441> for kings <WH4428> to commit <WH6213> wickedness, <WH7562> For a throne <WH3678> is established <WH3559> on righteousness. <WH6666>
Righteous <WH6664> lips <WH8193> are the delight <WH7522> of kings, <WH4428> And he who speaks <WH1696> right <WH3477> is loved. <WH157>
The wrath <WH2534> of a king <WH4428> is [as] messengers <WH4397> of death, <WH4194> But a wise <WH2450> man <WH376> will appease <WH3722> it.
In the light <WH216> of a king's face <WH6440> is life, <WH9132> And his favor <WH7522> is like a cloud <WH5645> with the spring <WH4456> rain. <WH4456>
How <WH4100> much better <WH2896> it is to get <WH7069> wisdom <WH2451> than <WH4480> gold! <WH2742> And to get <WH7069> understanding <WH998> is to be chosen <WH977> above <WH4480> silver. <WH3701>
The highway <WH4546> of the upright <WH3477> is to depart <WH5493> from evil; <WH9563> He who watches <WH5341> his way <WH1870> preserves <WH8104> his life. <WH5315>
Pride <WH1347> [goes] before <WH6440> destruction, <WH7667> And a haughty <WH1363> spirit <WH7307> before <WH6440> stumbling. <WH3783>
It is better <WH2896> to be of a humble <WH8217> spirit <WH7307> with the lowly, <WH6041> Than <WH4480> to divide <WH2505> the spoil <WH7998> with the proud. <WH1343>
He who gives <WH7919> attention <WH7919> to the word <WH1697> shall find <WH4672> good, <WH9185> And blessed <WH835> is he who trusts <WH982> in the Lord. <WH3068>
The wise <WH2450> in heart <WH3820> will be called <WH7121> discerning, <WH995> And sweetness <WH4986> of speech <WH8193> increases <WH3254> persuasiveness. <WH3948>
Understanding <WH7922> is a fountain <WH4726> of life <WH9132> to him who <WH1167> has <WH1167> it, But the discipline <WH4148> of fools <WH191> is folly. <WH200>
The heart <WH3820> of the wise <WH2450> teaches <WH7919> his mouth, <WH6310> And adds <WH3254> persuasiveness <WH3948> to his lips. <WH8193>
Pleasant <WH5278> words <WH561> are a honeycomb, <WH1706> <WH6688> Sweet <WH4966> to the soul <WH5315> and healing <WH4832> to the bones. <WH6106>
There <WH3426> is a way <WH1870> [which seems] right <WH3477> to a man, <WH376> But its end <WH319> is the way <WH1870> of death. <WH4194>
A worker's appetite <WH5315> works <WH5998> for him, For his hunger <WH6310> urges <WH404> him [on.]
A worthless <WH1100> man <WH376> digs <WH3738> up evil, <WH9567> While <WH5921> his words <WH8193> are as a scorching <WH9498> fire. <WH784>
A perverse <WH8419> man <WH376> spreads <WH7971> strife, <WH4066> And a slanderer <WH7279> separates <WH6504> intimate <WH9017> friends. <WH9017>
A man <WH376> of violence <WH2555> entices <WH6601> his neighbor, <WH7453> And leads <WH1980> him in a way <WH1870> that is not good. <WH2896>
He who winks <WH6095> his eyes <WH5869> [does so] to devise <WH2803> perverse <WH8419> things; <WH8419> He who compresses <WH7169> his lips <WH8193> brings <WH3615> evil <WH9567> to pass. <WH3615>
A gray <WH7872> head <WH7872> is a crown <WH5850> of glory; <WH8597> It is found <WH4672> in the way <WH1870> of righteousness. <WH6666>

He who <WH750> is slow <WH750> to anger <WH639> is better <WH2896> than <WH4480> the mighty, <WH1368> And he who rules <WH4910> his spirit, <WH7307> than <WH4480> he who captures <WH3920> a city. <WH5892>
The lot <WH1486> is cast <WH2904> into the lap, <WH2436> But its every <WH3605> decision <WH4941> is from the Lord. <WH3068>
